page.title: 07RECREATION
page.content: The Stanhoe & Barwick Social Club arranges events in the village throughout the year. Dances are held monthly and enjoy good attendances as to the whist drives held fortnightly through the winter. The Village Hall is L-shaped with a dance floor and a carpeted area, a kitchen with its cooker and there is a well stocked bar. Games include a pool table, indoor bowls, darts and a fruit machine all available for members on Club evenings. Happily there have never been problems in this lightly policed area. In the summer Club committee members organise fund-raising events, this year holding a fete on the small playing field, with stalls, games and a five-a-side football tournament for the local under 16's.
